channel.title: Audio on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Audio on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: ai: What’s new in Microsoft Foundry | Dec 2025 & Jan 2026
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry’s Dec 2025–Jan 2026 updates add several new foundation models, expand audio and fine-tuning capabilities, and introduce SDK changes including an azure-ai-projects v2 beta consolidation.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: Introducing GPT-4o Audio Models in Microsoft Foundry: A Practical Guide for Developers
item.description:
A practical developer guide from Microsoft Foundry showing how to start using Azure OpenAI’s next-generation GPT-4o audio models to build transcription and text-to-speech applications. The post explains the capabilities of the audio models, required setup in Azure/OpenAI and Foundry, best practices for integration, and considerations for testing, deployment, and costs.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: azure: [In development] Private Preview: Foundry Local Android support
item.description:
Foundry Local is entering Private Preview for Android, adding to existing Windows and Mac support to enable advanced on-device AI for smartphones, tablets, and IoT devices; the release also integrates Whisper models for privacy-preserving speech and audio processing.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Foundry Tools (rebrand from Azure AI Services)
item.description:
Microsoft announced Foundry Tools (rebranded from Azure AI Services) as generally available — a unified suite of prebuilt, production-ready AI capabilities for audio, video, images, documents, and text, seamlessly integrated into the Microsoft Foundry platform to empower developers.

  • Source: Azure Updates
